info.name: Vagus nerve
info.description: The tenth or vagus cranial nerve has both sensory and motor components which enter/exit the brain stem as a series of rootlets along the lateral aspect of the medulla dorsal to the olive and just caudal to the glossopharyngeal nerve. The most significant sensory component includes general sensation from the viscera, including input from the aortic body/sinus; the motor component innervates the laryngeal and pharyngeal muscles (4th and 6th pharyngeal arch origin) and provides the parasympathetic preganglionic fibers that innervate the thoracic and abdominal viscera.
